reviews.review_msg: He is a nice guy; smiles most of the time.  However, he does a terrible job of communicating the course material to students.  He rarely finishes a complete sentence making you completely lost in the subject content.  Worst thing is he is exactly the same if you talk to him during office hours.  Unable to teach well leads to tough midtermsfinal

Unfortunately I think she was completely overwhelmed with the class size, technology, and teaching. She read lines of R code in classes - did not really teach anything about the written stats she would actually be testing on for midterms and finals. You have to learn this course yourself, but I thought the tests were fairish for what was covered.
She doesn't know how to teach. Her assignment questions are SUPER hard.
very difficult and boring course, she doesn't explain well

Took Stat 350 with him last semester and I found his teaching abilities above and beyond standards. Pay attention on lectures since not everything useful is found on the slides. He was very flexible if students needed help during and out of office hours. Really liked his attitude towards students which made me respect him very much.

I flunked this course. I took his STAT270 long time ago, and I found it not bad. But when I took STAT350 it's a whole different world. He was mean. He thought the students are as smart as him. His exams are so hard that it's useless reading and memorizing his notes. DON'T take any of his courses.
He expects alot from students. He thinks everyone should be able to do the questions he designs.  He expects every students to be as smart as he is.
stat was easy before, but not anymore with swartz. His quizes are hard, final is hard with all the proofs you need to do. Swartz is A in teaching ability though.
he is a genius, ask him on biddng
Had a great time in his class. Explained concepts clearly & his lecture notes were very useful
He's a really nice informative prof. One of my favorite profs in sfu.

If you listen and follow his notes, you should be able to do very well.  He is a very fair professor.  He doesn't speak very loud, but if you get his notes, you don't miss anything.  Show up for class, read over his notes, and he is one of the most fair teachers out there!! :):) And he has a dry humor occasionally.

He mumbles a lot which makes it hard to listen even when you sit at the front. His class can be very boring, but his notes are awesome! One drawback is he uses different notations from the text, which can be confusing. His exams are pretty straightforward, assignment types. He keeps his words on lowering midterm worth when u did better on final.

The course material is not hard. However, to get good grades, you should follow her wording in the slides EXACTLY. Expecting to memorize a lot of concepts. Exams focus more on interpretation rather than math/proof. She is very willing to help during office hours. Personally, I think she is good if you spend enough time on this course.

Ummm. She was fine during lectures, seems to care. Her slides are informative and easy to read through. Tests and assignments were fair. The course was not curved though. The average was a C. I seriously wonder how many people failed lol..
